body_html:
I also had the same issue, and I'm not behind any proxy too.
For me, as in @mingdachen's case, conda kept trying to install the version in the default repo, instead of the one in the pytorch repo.
It seems that the latest version of mkl (>=2018) is one of the dependencies of pytorch v0.3.0, so the following line solved my problem (though downloading mkl is a bit slow).
conda install -c anaconda mkl

Before:

▶ conda install -c pytorch pytorch cuda90
Fetching package metadata ...........
Solving package specifications: .

Package plan for installation in environment /home/jhchoi/anaconda3/envs/ml:

The following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:

    cuda90:      1.0-h6433d27_0               pytorch
    cudatoolkit: 8.0-3
    cudnn:       6.0.21-cuda8.0_0
    nccl:        1.3.4-cuda8.0_1
    pytorch:     0.1.12-py36cuda8.0cudnn6.0_1

Proceed ([y]/n)? ^C%

After installing the latest mkl:

▶ conda install -c pytorch pytorch cuda90
Fetching package metadata ...........
Solving package specifications: .

The following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:

    pytorch: 0.3.0-py36_cuda9.0.176_cudnn7.0.3hdc18817_4 pytorch [cuda90]

Proceed ([y]/n)? y

I also had the same issue, and I'm not behind any proxy too.
For me, as in @mingdachen's case, conda kept trying to install the version in the default repo, instead of the one in the pytorch repo.
It seems that the latest version of mkl (>=2018) is one of the dependencies of pytorch v0.3.0, so the following line solved my problem (though downloading mkl is a bit slow).
`conda install -c anaconda mkl`

Before:
```
▶ conda install -c pytorch pytorch cuda90
Fetching package metadata ...........
Solving package specifications: .

Package plan for installation in environment /home/jhchoi/anaconda3/envs/ml:

The following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:

    cuda90:      1.0-h6433d27_0               pytorch
    cudatoolkit: 8.0-3
    cudnn:       6.0.21-cuda8.0_0
    nccl:        1.3.4-cuda8.0_1
    pytorch:     0.1.12-py36cuda8.0cudnn6.0_1

Proceed ([y]/n)? ^C%                                    
```

After installing the latest mkl:
